trans-unit.source: Configure an Azure Blob Destination
trans-unit.target: Configure an Azure Blob Destination

trans-unit.source: Configure an <token>azure_2</token> blob destination for sending messages from a <token>bridge</token> to a blob storage on <token>azure_2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Configure an <token>azure_2</token> blob destination for sending messages from a <token>bridge</token> to a blob storage on <token>azure_2</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can use an <token>azure_2</token> blob as a destination component only with <token>one-way</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use an <token>azure_2</token> blob as a destination component only with <token>one-way</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> to learn how to configure the bridge.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an XML One-Way Bridge</link> to learn how to configure the bridge.

trans-unit.source: Once you have added an <token>azure_2</token> blob destination component to the <token>msgflow</token> surface, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel> and connect the <token>bridge</token> to the Azure blob component.
trans-unit.target: Once you have added an <token>azure_2</token> blob destination component to the <token>msgflow</token> surface, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel> and connect the <token>bridge</token> to the Azure blob component.

trans-unit.source: To add an Azure blob destination to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>
trans-unit.target: To add an Azure blob destination to a <token>msgflow_proj</token>

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: See the steps at <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: See the steps at <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area thenselect <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area thenselect <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter your <token>af_integration</token>URL into the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Enter your <token>af_integration</token>URL into the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>azure_2</token> Blob Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>azure_2</token> Blob Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the Azure blob destination component.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the Azure blob destination component.

trans-unit.source: Shared Access Signature URL
trans-unit.target: Shared Access Signature URL

trans-unit.source: Enter the shared access signature (SAS) URL for the container in Azure Blob storage where the messages are routed to.
trans-unit.target: Enter the shared access signature (SAS) URL for the container in Azure Blob storage where the messages are routed to.

trans-unit.source: Note that the SAS URL must include the ‘si’ parameter.
trans-unit.target: Note that the SAS URL must include the ‘si’ parameter.

trans-unit.source: The ‘si’ parameter is included in the SAS URL if it was created using a shared access policy.
trans-unit.target: The ‘si’ parameter is included in the SAS URL if it was created using a shared access policy.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to generate the SAS URL, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj721951.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to generate the SAS URL, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Use a Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj721951.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Azure Storage Explorer to generate the SAS URL.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Azure Storage Explorer to generate the SAS URL.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure Storage Explorer, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=282292</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure Storage Explorer, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=282292</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
